results.title: Robert Boynes
results.creator_credit: Alan Cole, Ken Otton, Lloyd Carrick and Robert Lindsay
results.brief_description:
Episode number 7 of Series “Survey (National Gallery of Victoria)”.
Robert Boynes is often grouped with a number of Australian artists who, working from the mid 1960’s, are referred to as “Australian Pop” artists. Australian pop has its own distinct flavour, different from the U.S. and U.K. schools, and related to the Australian environment

results.title: Horses
results.brief_description: Two girls go cross-country-hacking. The film explains preparation, brushing, bridling, and saddling. Good introductory film to beginners and non-riders.

results.title: The Road to Charlie
results.creator_credit: Stuart Barry, Frank Bagnall, Zoran Janjic, Film Australia and Hanna-Barbera Productions
results.brief_description: Made for the Australian Department of Health, this animated film is part of the national drug education campaign. It attempts to show the difficulties of being a teenage individual in the world of group pressures and advises its young audience to look closely at the pressures to conform and carefully to assess their value. Written by Anne Brooksbank, animation by Stuart Barry.

results.title: The Southern edge: marsh and mangroves
results.creator_credit: Michael Vance, Robert Horne and ABC
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Wild Australia”.
Shows the dependence of Westernport Bay on the fringing salt-marsh and mangroves. We see the organisms of these vegetations in their natural surroundings and in the laboratory. Illustrates the density and diversity of the wildlife, and the changes along a transect from saltmarsh to sea. Narrated by Ross Thompson and introduced by Charles McCubbin.

results.title: The Year of the Kings
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Edge of the Cold”.
The final program in this series traces a full year’s life cycle of the King Penguin. These birds have had to adapt to a harsh environment on Macquarie Island, and have developed a well-organised social structure.

results.title: Quiet challenge
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Big country”.
Concerned about Australia’s lack of success in international sports aviation events, ex-businessman Bill Reilly has established a school for advanced glider-pilot training at Tokamore, N.S.W. Resident championship Ingo Reuner, aeronautical pilot and Bert Persson, engineer, display their skills and explain the fascination that gliding holds for them.

results.title: Lyrebird: master of mimicry
results.brief_description: Lyrebirds in Sherbrooke Forest in the Dandenong Ranges, Victoria. Shows the lyrebirds displaying their powers of mimicry - the sounds they emit are extremely varied and cover a large vocal range. Few animals call for such a long period. They imitate all the other birds of the forest, the whip bird, kookaburra, a flock of rosellas and many others. Also includes their own distinctive calls and dance.

results.title: Strange creature: the echidna
results.creator_credit: David Corke, CSIRO and Educational Media Australia
results.brief_description: A simplified version for schools and general audiences of the prize-winning CSIRO film “The Echidna”. Experienced naturalists have seen for the first time in this film the young echidna in its mother’s pouch at different stages of growth. Highlights its uniqueness as an egg-laying mammal and shows the echidna in its natural habitat, feeding, reproductive techniques and development of the young.

results.title: My family
results.brief_description: Salma gives a first-hand account of being a refugee. Fleeing the conflict in Sudan, she talks about the pain and anxiety of her journey to Australia, as well as the gratitude she feels for her new country.
